.larger[.hand[Why should I use ggplot2?]]

.pull-left[
**Pros** 

- Simple to create complex plots

- Programmatic interface

- Minimal changes to change visualization types 

- Default customizations are desirable
]

.pull-right[
![](images/ggplot_logo.png)

**Cons** 

- New syntax to learn! 
]


---

.pull-left[
.larger[`ggplot()`]

- Same syntax for every plot
- Change `geom`etric object for different plots
]

--

.pull-right[
.larger["base" R]

Different functions for different types of plots

- Scatterplot: `plot()`
- Boxplot: `boxplot()`
- Histogram: `hist()` 
- Density plot: `density()`
- Bar plot: `barplot()`
]

---

class: inverse

.larger[.hand[ggplot2 first steps]]

```{r, fig.align='center', out.width = "50%"}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(mapping = aes(y = manufacturer))
```

---

.larger[Step 1: Start with a blank plot]

```{r, fig.height = 5, fig.align='center'}
ggplot(data = mpg)
```

---

class: middle, center 

.larger[Step 2: Add (`+`) a `geom`]

</br> 
</br> 

```{r add, eval = FALSE, echo = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar()
```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
decorate("add", eval = FALSE) %>% 
  flair("+", color = "red") %>% 
  flair("geom", color = "blue")
```

---

class: middle, center

.larger[Map variables to **aes**thetics]

```{r aes, eval = FALSE, echo = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(mapping = aes(y = manufacturer)
)
```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
decorate("aes", eval = FALSE) %>% 
  flair("aes")
```

```{r, echo = FALSE, out.width = "50%"}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(mapping = aes(y = manufacturer))
```

---

class: middle, center

.larger[A reusable template]

</br>

```{r, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(data = <DATA>) + 
  <GEOM_FUNCTION>(mapping = aes(<MAPPINGS>))
```

---

class: inverse, middle, center

.larger[.hand[What is an **aes**thetic?]]

---

.larger[An aesthetic is a visual property of the objects in your plot.]

</br>

.large[
- variables on axes 
- size, shape, or the color of points

</br>

>"You can convey information about your data by mapping the aesthetics in your
> plot to the variables in your dataset."

]

---

.larger[Axes]

<center>
```{r axes, eval = FALSE, echo = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy))
```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
decorate_chunk(chunk_name = "axes", eval = FALSE) %>% 
  flair(pattern = "x = displ", color = "tomato") %>% 
  flair(pattern = "y = hwy", color = "blue")
```

</center>
</br> 

.large[

- Maps **`disp`** to `r flair("x-axis", pattern = "x-axis", color = "tomato")`
- Maps **`hwy`** to `r flair("y-axis", pattern = "y-axis", color = "blue")`
]

---

.larger[Fill the Bars]

.pull-left[
```{r, echo = FALSE}
mpg <- mpg %>% 
  mutate(cyl = as.factor(cyl))
```

```{r fill, echo = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(mapping = 
             aes(y = manufacturer, 
                 fill = cyl)
           )
```
]

.pull-right[
```{r, echo = FALSE}
decorate_chunk(chunk_name = "fill", eval = FALSE) %>% 
  flair(pattern = "fill = cyl", color = "green")
```

- `r flair("fill", pattern = "fill", color = "green")` points based on
the number of **`cyl`**inders the vehicle has
]

---

.larger[Don't Color the Bars]

.pull-left[
```{r, echo = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(mapping = 
             aes(y = manufacturer, 
                 color = cyl)
           )
```
]

.pull-right[
```{r, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(mapping = 
             aes(y = manufacturer, 
                 color = cyl)
           )
```
]

---

.larger[Color the Points]

.pull-left[
```{r color, echo = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(
    mapping = aes(x = displ,
                  y = hwy,
                  color = cyl)
    )
```
]

.pull-right[
```{r, echo = FALSE}
decorate_chunk(chunk_name = "color", eval = FALSE) %>% 
  flair(pattern = "color = cyl", color = "red")
```

- `r flair("fill", pattern = "color", color = "red")` points based on
the number of **`cyl`**inders the vehicle has
]

---
.larger[Shape]

.pull-left[
```{r shape, echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE,}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(
    mapping = aes(x = displ,
                  y = hwy,
                  shape = class))
```
]

.pull-right[
```{r, echo = FALSE}
decorate_chunk(chunk_name = "shape", eval = FALSE) %>% 
  flair(pattern = "shape = class", color = "purple")
```

- Uses a different `r flair("shape", pattern = "shape", color = "purple")` points based on **`class`** of vehicles
]

---

.larger[Size]

.pull-left[
```{r size, echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_point(
    mapping = aes(x = displ, 
                  y = hwy, 
                  size = cyl))
```
]

.pull-right[
```{r, echo = FALSE}
decorate_chunk(chunk_name = "size", eval = FALSE) %>% 
  flair(pattern = "size = cyl", color = "red")
```

- Uses a different `r flair("size", pattern = "size", color = "red")` points based on **`ncyl`** of the vehicle
]

---

.larger["Plain" Aesthetics]

.pull-left[
.large[
Assign a single `color`, `shape`, or `size` to **all** points 
]
```{r, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(mapping = aes(y = manufacturer), 
           color = "tomato")
```
]

.pull-right[

```{r, echo = FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.height = 6}
ggplot(data = mpg) + 
  geom_bar(mapping = aes(y = manufacturer), 
           fill = "tomato")
```
]
